instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

threads.title: 01598 liquid damage
threads.message:
hi there
these are quite new to me still, dont get them often.
So i fixed a short on ppbus, was caused by C9074 which spontaneously died i think (liquid was not near this at all)
It's hard to find liquid on this guy, but i found some traces broken around U5111 (which i think arent critical)

Anyway, i get ppbus 12.6V now
all the G3H stuff is there, i am getting p3v3main_pgood, and P5VG3S_PGOOD
I cant really find the page with all the rails, but im trying my best.

I'm missing PP3V3_S5, which i think is being created by U7800 if im not mistaken?
Theres a giant shield over U7800 (and U3900) so am waiting to check in here first before i remove that shield and possibly ruin stuff under it.

threads.title: 01598 liquid damage
threads.message: Voltage and current on USB-C? Did you try to follow power sequence?

threads.title: 01598 liquid damage
threads.message: Do you get other voltages from U7800 (SYM 1 OF 4)?

threads.title: 01598 liquid damage
threads.message:
yeah sorry forgot to add the obvious: board is asking 20v and draws 0.00amps

LDOs from U7800:

LDO_CORE = 1.50V
PP0V8_SLPS2R = 0.8V
PP3V_G3H_RTC = 3.0V
PP1V2_AWAKE = 1.20V
PMU_LDO3_OUT_R = 1.8V

PP3V3_G3H_PMU_VDDMAIN = 3.29V

threads.title: 01598 liquid damage
threads.message: Power on sequence mentions that 3V3_S5 appears after PMU_ONOFF_L is triggered.

threads.title: 01598 liquid damage
threads.message:
ok, i was under the assumption these would start automatically when charger is connected.
I realised there was a power diagram yesterday and indeed saw that same sequence, so tried triggering PMU-ONOFF_L to ground with tweezers while measuring PP3v3_S5: but no response, no pulsing either.

threads.title: 01598 liquid damage
threads.message:
so following the power on sequence:
I am having everything up until  SSD0_OCARINA_WP_L
Have no idea where that's from (i'm assuming PMIC here) 

SSD0_OCARINA_PFN is there at 1.8v
SSD0_OCARINA_RESET_L is 0.0v

threads.title: 01598 liquid damage
threads.message: Do you get correct level for 0V9_SSD0 and 2V5_NAND_SSD0?

threads.title: 01598 liquid damage
threads.message: yes, both are present at 0.9 and 2.5v

threads.title: 01598 liquid damage
threads.message:
The board should start by itself when charger is connected; if no battery connected.
PMU_ONOFF_L is needed to turn on the board only if battery alone is connected (no charger).

Looks like T2 is not able to access dedicated partition on SSD.
Try DFU restore, just in case.

threads.title: 01598 liquid damage
threads.message: well i cant get this thing to do anything, cannot get it into DFU mode.
